meanings.definition: To occupy again, as a place previously inhabited.
meanings.sent1: After the renovations, the family decided to reinhabit their old house.
meanings.sent2: The birds will reinhabit the nest once the storm passes.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous rabbits decided to reinhabit the cozy burrow after their short vacation.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the memories of childhood reinhabited the old playground.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers reinhabited the garden, bringing back nostalgic feelings.

meanings.definition: To return to living in a place that was previously abandoned or uninhabited.
meanings.sent1: The villagers planned to reinhabit the village after the floodwaters receded.
meanings.sent2: Nature slowly began to reinhabit the deserted island, reclaiming its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The curious explorer decided to reinhabit the ancient ruins for a night of adventure.
meanings.sent4: Hope reinhabits the hearts of the people as they rebuild their homes.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children reinhabited the empty school halls, filling them with joy once more.
